appDescription.message: Provides end-to-end protection for your email using OpenPGP.

usageDescription.message: E2EMail allows you to send protected emails using your Gmail account.
usageDescription.description: Description of what the app does.

welcomeTitle.description: Title for a screen that's shown to a not logged in user of E2EMail.

signInAndPermissions.description: Title for a screen that's shown to a not logged in user of E2EMail.

permissions.description: Title for a screen that's shown to a logged in user of E2EMail who has not authorized the app.

accessEmail.description: Title for a screen that's shown to a not logged in user of E2EMail.

attachmentsSize.message: Maximum size limits of attachments is exceeded.
attachmentsSize.description: The size of the attachments has been exceeded.

deleteEmail.message: 2. Delete email in your Gmail inbox
deleteEmail.description: Title for giving access to delete mail in your Gmail inbox permission.

logInEmailAccess.message: 2. Give E2Email access to your email
logInEmailAccess.description: Title for a giving access to Gmail permission.

emailAccessWhy.message: This lets E2Email send and receive protected emails using your Gmail account.
emailAccessWhy.description: Reason for asking email access permission.

logInDeleteAccess.message: 3. Give E2Email access to delete mail your Gmail inbox
logInDeleteAccess.description: Title for giving access to delete mail in your Gmail inbox permission.

deleteAccessWhy.message: This lets E2Email remove protected emails from your Gmail account if you delete them within the app.
deleteAccessWhy.description: Reason for asking email delete permission.

signInChrome.description: Title for a screen that's shown to a not logged in user of E2EMail.

openGmailSettings.description: Title for a button that's shown to a not authorized user of E2EMail.

appinfoTitle.description: Title for information about the app itself.

inviteTitle.description: Title for a button that's shown to invite a friend of the user to install E2EMail.

requestApprovalStatus.message: Requesting access, in a few seconds an approval dialog should appear...
requestApprovalStatus.description: Status shown when the app wants to request OAuth approvals.

approvalUnavailableStatus.message: Could not obtain approval to access your Gmail account.
approvalUnavailableStatus.description: Status shown when the app is unable to obtain OAuth approvals.

inviteInProgressStatus.description: Status message while an unencrypted mail is being sent to a friend to invite them to install E2EMail.

welcomeHelp.message: In order to encrypt messages using Gmail, E2Email needs you to:
welcomeHelp.description: Informational text for a user giving them a reason to use E2EMail.

authorizationHelp.message: In order to encrypt messages using Gmail, E2Email needs permissions to:
authorizationHelp.description: Informational text for a user giving them a reason to use E2EMail.

signIn.description: Button text to let the user know they are about to logged into Chrome.

setupInfo.description: Help text describing what's going on when the user's account is being checked or set up.

settings.description: Noun to describe a screen that lets the user check and alter application settings.

faq.description: Noun to describe a screen that shows frequently asked questions.

issues.description: Noun to describe a screen that shows an issues form.

recover.description: Verb to describe how to recover access to the account.

recoverScreenTitle.description: Title for a screen where the user can recover access to their account.

recoveryCodeInput.description: Title for the instruction prior to the recovery code input box.

recoverHelp.message: You have previously installed E2EMail. Please enter your recovery code to access your encrypted mail.
recoverHelp.description: Help text to help the user understand why they need to recover their account, and what they need to do to recover it.

refresh.description: Verb to describe how to refresh the mailbox.

recoveryCode.description: Noun to describe the private key backup code.

resetLink.message: I forgot my code, reset E2EMail.
resetLink.description: Short link text to give the user an option to reset their account.

initializeStatus.description: Status message when the app is being initialized.

checkAuthorizedStatus.description: Status message when the app checks for Gmail API authorizations.

checkPrivateKeyStatus.description: Status message when the app checks for a local private key.

checkRegisteredKeyStatus.description: Status message when the app checks for a remote public key.

createKeyStatus.description: Status message when the app is creating a keypair.

updateKeyStatus.description: Status message when the app is registering a public key.

sendWelcomeMailStatus.description: Status message when the app is sending a welcome email.

incorrectCodeStatus.message: This code is not correct, please check for typos.
incorrectCodeStatus.description: Status displayed when characters not corresponding to a recovery code is entered.

resetTitle.description: Title for a view that is shown when the user is about to reset their private key.

resetHelp.message: You are here because you want to reset your E2EMail data.
resetHelp.description: Help text shown to confirm to the user why they are in this view.

resetAnywayLink.description: Link text the user must press to create a new private key.

resetWarning.message: If you reset your data, any email you sent or received with your previous E2EMail recovery code will no longer be readable.
resetWarning.description: Help text that warns the user about the consequences of creating a new private key for their account.

resetKeyStatus.description: Status message when a new private key is being generated because the user requested it.

sendMailStatus.description: Status message when a new mail is being sent.

resetMailSubject.description: (Unencrypted) subject line in an email sent when a new private key was generated by the user resetting their account.

resetMailContent.message: Your E2EMail account was reset by a device connected to your account.
resetMailContent.description: (Encrypted) content in an email sent when a new private key was generated by the user resetting their account.

welcomeMailSubject.description: (Unencrypted) subject line in an email sent to a user who has installed E2EMail for the first time.

welcomeMailContent.message:
You can now send and receive encrypted mail. Just hit reply to reply to an existing email thread, or new to start a new one.

The E2E team.
welcomeMailContent.description: (Encrypted) content mailed to a user who has installed E2EMail for the first time.

inviteMailSubject.description: (Unencrypted) subject line in an email sent to a user who is being invited to install E2EMail.

inviteMailContent.message:
Here's an invite to preview a Chrome app that lets us exchange private (OpenPGP encrypted) mail over Gmail.

You can find the E2EMail app here, send me a private email if you install it.
$LOCATION$
inviteMailContent.description: (Unencrypted) content mailed to a user who is being invited to install E2EMail.

newDeviceMailSubject.message: A new device was added to E2EMail
newDeviceMailSubject.description: (Unencrypted) subject line in an email sent to a user who has installed E2EMail in a new device.

newDeviceMailContent.message: A new device was added to your E2EMail account by entering your recovery code.
newDeviceMailContent.description: (Encrypted) content mailed to a user who has installed E2EMail in a new device.

missingCodeStatus.description: Text when a user has not entered a recovery code.

checkingCodeStatus.description: Text while the application verifies a recovery code.

sendNotificationStatus.description: Text while the application sends a notification email.

showsecretTitle.description: Title for a screen that shows the user's recovery code.

showsecretHelpIntro.message: Without this code, any E2EMail messages will be lost forever if you lose this device.
showsecretHelpIntro.description: Introductory message for a screen that shows the user's recovery code.

showsecretHelpSteps.message: Write your code on a piece of paper and store it somewhere safe:
showsecretHelpSteps.description: Steps in securing recovery code within a screen that shows the user's recovery code.

settingsSecretHelp.message: This is a secret code which can unlock your E2EMail on a different device, or if you lose this device. Without this code, any E2EMail messages will be lost forever, so please write this code on paper and store it securely.
settingsSecretHelp.description: Help for a settings screen that shows the user's recovery code.

continue.description: Verb to use on a button to indicate the next thing.

getStarted.description: Verb to use on a button to get started with the app.

setupAccount.description: Verb to use on a button to indicate the start setting up a new account.

endtoendProtection.description: Describes the type of protection for the email service.

recipientInfo.message: Only the recipient will be able to read your emails.
recipientInfo.description: Describes who will be able to read the encrypted emails user sends.

completeSetup.description: Verb to use on a button to complete the Setup of the account.

generateCodeStatus.description: Status when generating a recovery code from a key.

noSubjectTitle.description: Title to use when the message has no subject.

fetchMessageStatus.description: Status when fetching a message via the Gmail API

emptyFieldsError.description: Message to display when there are missing entries in a form.

noKeysForMessageError.message: This message was protected under another recovery code and can no longer be read.
noKeysForMessageError.description: Message to display when the private key for a message is missing.

recoveryCodeTooShortError.message: This recovery code is too short.
recoveryCodeTooShortError.description: Message to display when the recovery code is too short.

invalidSignatureError.message: Could not verify $EMAIL$ sent this message.
invalidSignatureError.description: Error when signature verification fails for a message

noThreadsMessage.message: No private messages in your mailbox.
noThreadsMessage.description: Status shown when the user has no threads in their inbox

noThreadsTitle.description: Title shown when the user has no threads in their inbox

inboxCountTitle.description: Title showing count of unread and total threads in inbox

invalidDecryptionContentError.description: Error when the contents of a message have something wrong with it.

fingerprintChangedStatus.message: $EMAIL$ has recently altered their E2EMail identity code.
fingerprintChangedStatus.description: Status text shown when the code detects a recipients public key has changed.

fingerprintSettingsHelp.message: This sequence of letters and numbers can be used as an identity check when you send people emails. To verify that they are really receiving an email from you, they can give you a call and confirm your ID, which should match the ID they see when they click on your name in an email you've sent them. E2Email will warn them if your ID changes across emails they receive.
fingerprintSettingsHelp.description: Help text to display within the settings screen underneath the user's fingerprint

fingerprintHelp1.message: This sequence of numbers and digits can be used as an identity check for $EMAIL$.
fingerprintHelp1.description: First paragraph of help text to help user understand what a fingerprint is, and how to use it.

fingerprintChangedHelp1.message: However, E2EMail has noticed this code has changed since you first started talking with $EMAIL$. Most often, this happens if they have reset their account, but you should confirm this by talking directly to them and verifying their latest identity code.
fingerprintChangedHelp1.description: Help text shown when the code detects a recipients public key has changed.

fingerprintHelp2.message: To verify if you are really receiving an email from them, give them a call and confirm their ID, which they can find in the Account menu of the E2EMail app.
fingerprintHelp2.description: Second paragraph of help text to help user understand what a fingerprint is, and how to use it.

whatsThis.description: Informal phrase for a link that provides more explanation about a topic.

gotIt.description: Informal phrase for a link that acknowledges the user has understood some information.

idCheck.description: Title to describe an identity check code (fingerprint.)

fetchMessageMissingError.message: E2EMail was unable to find the encrypted content within this email. This can happen if the email was sent by a different application. (dogfood debug: $ID$)
fetchMessageMissingError.description: Error with missing data when fetching a message via the Gmail API

messageMissingThreadError.description: An application error that is unable to find the thread for a message.

fetchMessageError.description: Error when Gmail API rejects fetching information about a particular message

serverKeyNotAvailableError.message: Unable to find E2EMail information for $EMAIL.
serverKeyNotAvailableError.description: Error when the email is sent from someone without a key on the key server.

messageEncodingError.description: Error when the attachment doesn't contain a valid encoding.

missingRecipientAlert.message: $EMAIL$ has not installed E2EMail, so you cannot send private email to them. Do you want to invite them to install E2EMail instead?
missingRecipientAlert.description: Alert message when the user selects a recipient who hasn't installed E2EMail.

verifyRecipientStatus.description: Status message when E2EMail is checking the public key for a recipient.

invalidRecipientAlert.message: $EMAIL$ is not a proper email address. Please enter a complete address (eg: example@gmail.com)
invalidRecipientAlert.description: Alert message when the user enters an invalid email address.

fetchBatchStatus.description: Status when fetching a batch of messages from Gmail

fetchContactsStatus.description: Status when fetching a batch of contacts from Gmail

typeReplyPlaceholder.description: Placeholder text for a textbox where the user types in a reply to a message.

typeMessagePlaceholder.message: Anything typed under here is sent privately.
typeMessagePlaceholder.description: Placeholder text for a textbox where the user types in a new message.

invalidRecipientPlaceholder.message: Please enter a valid To address first.
invalidRecipientPlaceholder.description: Placeholder text for a textbox where the user hasn't yet typed in an email address.

reply.description: Verb to use on a button to reply to a message.

cancel.description: Verb to use on a button to cancel an action.

send.description: Verb to use on a button to send a message.

compose.description: Verb to use on a button to compose a new message.

inbox.description: Noun to describe the primary user inbox.

trashHelp.description: Text to display when hovering over the trash icon.

primaryEmailTitle.description: Title for a settings screen to describe the user's email address.

selectThreadTitle.description: Title for a checkbox to select an email thread.

messagesTitle.description: Title for a screen that shows the messages within a thread.

showsecretDocumentTitle.description: Document title for the user's secret code.

unsupportedMimeContent.description: Message shown for mime content that cannot be displayed.

mimePreamble.message: This is an OpenPGP/MIME encrypted message. Please open it from the E2EMail app.
mimePreamble.description: A notification appearing before the actual MIME content. MIME compliant parsers will not display this message to the user.

errorInParsingMime.message: Parsing error: This message has not been formatted correctly and cannot be displayed.
errorInParsingMime.description: A notification that is displayed when an email contains MIME content that has not been formatted correctly
